## Institutional Archives Powering The Connections Project

Collections organized by institution, with notes on network contributions.

### Howard University
- <a href="https://library.howard.edu/moorland-spingarn" target="_blank">Moorland-Spingarn Research Center</a>  
  Kelly Miller Papers, Negro Sanhedrin records. **Primary source for brokerage centrality** - documents Miller's connections between Du Bois, Washington, and HBCU presidents.
- <a href="https://dh.howard.edu/university-archives" target="_blank">University Archives</a>  
  Faculty lists, dean records (Miller 1903-1939). **Institutional overlap edges** between Haynes, Miller, and modern faculty.

### Catholic University of America
- <a href="https://guides.lib.cua.edu/msscoll/photo-collection" target="_blank">University Archives Photograph Collection</a>  
  Euphemia Haynes photos, dissertation records. **Visual + biographical metadata** for Haynes network position.
- <a href="https://libraries.catholic.edu/archives-special-collections/university-archives.html" target="_blank">PhD Dissertation Collection</a>  
  Haynes' 1943 *Symmetric Correspondences*. **Earliest node attributes** for first Black woman math PhD.

### Library of Congress
- <a href="https://findingaids.loc.gov/repositories/19/archival_objects/3143557" target="_blank">Manuscript Division - Kelly Miller Papers</a>  
  Correspondence with Du Bois, Washington. **Highest-quality correspondence edges** - direct evidence of intellectual networks.

### District of Columbia Public Library
- <a href="https://www.dclibrary.org/researching-dc-history/dc-public-schools" target="_blank">DC Public Schools Historical Collection</a>  
  Haynes' teaching records (Miner Teachers College). **Classroom mentorship ties** - student advising networks.
